result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan C Munguia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12/04/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found the Domestic Abuse is applicable. Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

records.addlTxt: Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant Juan C Munguia in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.

Defendant Juan C Munguia in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Maricela L.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as no DNA sample was taken.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan C Munguia in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 6 FOR BRANCH 40.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan C Munguia in court with attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives Spanish interpreter for purposes of today's hearing.
For reasons stated on the record, Court orders case adjourned for further final pre-trial in Branch 40.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.
